parts.text: Crop rotation is a common practice on Irish tillage farms.

parts.text: Seán and Lisa are beef and sheep farmers in the west of Ireland. They are concerned about the environment and the effect agriculture is having on the planet. Briefly explain two ways in which they could increase biodiversity on their farm.
The use of 3D plans are likely to become more common in the future development of new infrastructure of farms.

subparts.text: Identify the structure located at B.
Describe one environmental hazard and one potential safety hazard of structure B. Environmental: Safety hazard:
Outline one way in which the farmyard layout is economically sustainable.
Explain how one named piece of new technology that you have studied could enhance economy of labour on this farm.

parts.text: The following is a plan view of a combined robot milking unit and cow housing for Claire and John who plan to convert their suckler farm to a dairy farm.

subparts.text: Explain why they have included an isolation area on the plan.
Describe the purpose of the footbath.
Outline one reason why Claire and John would have opted to install a robotic milking machine rather than a traditional herringbone or rotary parlour.
Place an X on the plan view above to show one place where you would advise Claire and John to install slatted tanks. Give a reason for your recommendation.

parts.text:
(i) Identify the estimated cost of liver fluke to Irish farmers annually.
(ii) Outline one environmental condition that allows liver fluke to thrive.
(iii) Suggest three ways in which farmers can control / prevent liver fluke on their farm.

(i) Which county has the highest % fluke damage?
(ii) State one reason why the fluke damage in Cork is less than in more northern counties.

(i) Explain notifiable disease.
(ii) List two notifiable diseases found in Irish farm animals.
(iii) Outline the importance to Irish Agriculture of farmers complying with regulations in relation to notifiable diseases.
(iv) State three practices farmers could employ to ensure good biosecurity on their farm.
(v) Discuss three management practices farmers should consider when housing farm animals to ensure high standards of animal welfare.

subparts.text: Name two dairy breeds that a farmer would choose to produce good quality milk for the dairy industry.
Maintaining hygiene before, during and after milking is important for both cow health and achieving a good milk price. Outline any three ways a farmer can maintain high 3.
Dairy farmers obtain a price for their milk based on the quality of their milk. List any two tests carried out on milk that are used in calculating the milk price paid to the farmer.
Apart from hygiene practices, briefly explain two ways dairy farmers could improve the quality of the milk on their farm.
